title: Sci-Fi Robotic Sound Effects
description: A collection of 250 robotic sound effects including robot movement, sounds of sensors, devices and interfaces, broken-downs and failures, launches, charges, energy sounds, stimulants, voices, and more.
longDescription:
Audio Preview: https://soundcloud.com/magic-sound-effects/scifi-robotic-sound-effects-short-preview

Sound List: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5dkh5kismkd48pa/MSE%20-%20Sci-Fi%20Robotic%20Sound%20Effects_v1.0.pdf?dl=0


The collection of sound effects, made in a futuristic sci-fi style, is designed to solve the most ambitious tasks in projects where robotic life forms and mechs live, are charged from unlimited sources of energy, break down and fail, fight and die.


The package contains 250 sound effects, divided into 7 folders: 

  1. «Broken»
  2. «Devices»
  3. «Energy»
  4. «FX»
  5. «Interfaces»
  6. «Movement»
  7. «Voices»


Among the wide variety of sounds you will find the following events - broken robots, charging, device sounds, failures, launches, mechanisms, sensors, appearance of energy and energy batteries, broken batteries, sparks and deactivation, force fields, sounds of robotic particles, feeders, interfaces and dashboards, stimulants, robot footsteps and movements, accompanied by metal and energy sounds, voice sounds.


The sound library is perfect for sounding robots, interface components of futuristic vehicles and spaceships, various forms of alien life and energies, sci-fi mechanisms and cyberpunk devices, protective barriers, elements of space stations and extraterrestrial life, and more.


All sound effects are designed with different synthesizers, which means that there is no extraneous noise in them. For some sounds, additional reverb and delay processing has been used.


You can also mix sound effects with each other to create even more sound variations.


For support and other questions, please send an email to: magic.sound.effects@gmail.com.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • 250 sound effects
  • 44.1 kHz, 16 bit, wav, stereo
  • wide variety of futuristic systems and mechanisms
  • great for all types of robotic lifeforms, space transportation, sci-fi vehicles, futuristic interfaces, and more


Number of Audio Waves: 250

Number of Audio Cues: 250

Sample rate / bit rate: 44,100 Hz / 16 Bit

Do Sound FX loop: No

Minutes of audio provided: 10 minutes 34 seconds

Supported Development Platforms: All

  • Windows: Yes
  • Mac: Yes
